title.narrative: Lupanda Beans Production and Marketing Expansion Project

description.narrative: Sector: Agriculture - Beans.Beneficiaries: 168 small scale farmers, of which 91 are women.Lupanda Cooperative is a member owned cooperative that is located in Khosolo, Mzimba district. The members mainly grow beans for consumption and sale and maize for food security purposes. The cooperative has been implementing a USADF capacity building grant (EDI) and are requesting an expansion of the project. Under the EDI, the cooperative managed to increase its production from below 10 Metric Tons (MT) to 70MT by year 2. In addition, the cooperative now has basic financial and operation systems in place to better manage the cooperative and further increase production and eventually improve livelihoods.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

title.narrative: South Mzimba NASFAM Sunflower Expansion Project

description.narrative: South Mzimba Union Smallholder Farmers Association Limited (SOMU) is a union of five associations composed of 13,000 (7,266 Women and 5,734 men) active members growing different crops including sunflower, tobacco, soybean, maize and groundnuts. Out of these 13,000 members, 7, 000 are growing sunflower. The Union was formed with assistance from National Smallholder Farmers Association (NASFAM).The purpose of the organization is to improve the livelihood of its farmer members by providing agri-business and social services to its smallholder farmer members. ..With assistance from USADF, SOMU has implemented a capacity building project for 2 years (June 2015 to December 2016) and the project. Some of the project's achievements include increased production of sunflower, increased membership and improved financial and organisational management...However, several challenges were experienced in the last couple of years including frequent electricity power cuts, high transport costs, low prices of crude oil; frequent machine breakdown and small storage capacity that did not meet Malawi Bureau of Standards specification..SOMU would like to implement an expansion grant to improve efficiency, effectiveness and competitiveness of their oil on the market to ensure sustainability of the business by tackling some of the problems mentioned above.
